title: DoNER Secretary Inspects Kawlri Tlang Cultural Heritage Centre in Serchhip
content:
346/2025-2026

16th January, 2026 :Secretary of the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER), Pu Chanchal Kumar, today visited Serchhip and inspected the under-construction Cultural Heritage Centre at Kawlri Tlang.

The Kawlri Tlang Cultural Heritage Centre is being constructed under the initiative of the Hon’ble Chief Minister of Mizoram, Pu Lalduhoma, who is also the MLA of the Serchhip constituency. The project is funded under the North Eastern Council (NEC). Construction work began in September 2024 and is planned to be completed by early this year. The total project cost is ₹4.31 crore, and the work is being executed by Excell Consultancy Services under the Public Works Department (PWD). As of now, 65 percent of the work has been completed.

During the visit, the DoNER Secretary inspected the site in detail and instructed the contractor to complete the work as expeditiously as possible. He also assured that there is no funding constraint from the Ministry. In addition to the original plan, he suggested the inclusion of a trekking route.

The DoNER Secretary was accompanied by UD&PA Secretary Pu Lalmalsawma, Serchhip Deputy Commissioner Pu Paul L. Khuma, Additional Deputy Commissioner Pu Lalrinzuala, and other officials.

title: DoNER Secretary-in Serchhip Kawlri tlanga Cultural Heritage Centre sak mek a tlawh
content:
2954/2025-2026

Dated Serchhip, the 16th January, 2025:Vawiin khan Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER) Secretary Pu Chanchal Kumar chuan Serchhip tlawhin Kawlri tlanga Cultural Heritage Centre sak mek a tlawh.

Kawlri Tlanga Cultural Heritage Centre sak mek hi Mizoram Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma, Serchhip bialtu MLA ni bawk hmalaknaa sak niin North Eastern Council (NEC) hnuaia sum hmuh hmanga sak a ni a. September 2024 khan kuthhlak tan niin kumin kum bul lama zawh hman tura duan a ni a. He Project atana sum dah chu cheng vaibelchhe 4.31 niin PWD hnuaiah Excell Consultancy Services chuan an thawk a. Vawiin thleng hian za zelah 65 thawh zawh tawh a ni.

DoNER Secretary hian a hmunhma chipchiar taka fangin contractor chu a rang thei ang bera hna thawk zo turin a hrilh a. Ministry atangin funding ah harsatna a awm loh thu a sawi. Tangkai zawka hman a nih theih nan leh mipuite pawhin an hlut zual theih nan trekking route siam dan tur ruahman tel ni se tiin rawtna a siam bawk.

Kawlri Tlang hi Zoluti lak let lehna hmun niin Serchhip Heritage Society chuan Mizo History vawn nunna tur te, zin mite hip nan leh a hmunhmaa khuanu thil siam thing leh mau te vawnhimna ni pahfawmin he hmun hi chei a nih theih nan hun rei tak hma an lo la tawh a. Bialtu MLA hmalaknain hna hi kalpui a ni ta a. A bul lawkah hian Chawngpuii Khawthlir leh Pastor Chhawna Tawngtaina In siam a lo ni tawh bawk a ni.

DoNER Minister hi UD&PA Secretary Pu Lalmalsawma, Serchhip DC Pu Paul L Khuma, Additional DC Pu Lalrinzuala leh mi pawimawh dang ten an tawiawm a ni.

DoNER Secretary hian vawiin vek khan Thenzawla Helipad and Heliport siamna tur te, Thenzawl Peace City Greenfield Development siamna tur te leh Thenzawl Venghluna Handloom Cluster te a tlawh bawk a ni.

title: MIPUITE HRIATTIRNA: SMART METER VUAH TAWHTE TAN BILLING PERIOD SIAM REM DAWN - P&ED
content:
2952/2025-2026

Dt 16th January, 2026:Smart Meter vuah tawh consumer te tana bill siam chungchangah consumer te hriattur pawimawh a hnuai ami ang hian Engineer-in-Chief, Power & Electricity Department chuan a hnuai ami ang hian hriattirna a chhuah:

January, 2026 thla atang hian Smart Meter vuah tawh consumer thenkhat te tan smart reading (automatic a smart meter in reading a chhinchiah) hmanga bill siam tan a ni tawh a. Heng consumer ho tan hian billing cycle/billing period siamrem ngei ngei a ngai a. Hemi insiamrem thla bik hi billing period thla khat aia rei te a awm a, chumi a nih avang chuan hemi thla bik hi bill a tam deuh tur a ngaih a ni. A hnu a bill kal leh zel tur ah erawh billing period hi thla khat zel a ni tawh ang. Billing period siamrem hi Smart Meter vuah thar apiang te ah a tahtawlin kalpui a ni ang.

Bill period rei avanga vawikhata bill pek harsate tan bialtu SDO te remtihna la in Bill Counter ah installment a pek theih a ni ang.

Zawhfiahduh nei apiang te tan mahni Sub-Division Office ah Office hour chhungin zawhfiahtheih reng a ni.

title: ADVISER TO CM HOVIN MISSION ORGANIC MIZORAM HNUAIA FPC-TE MEETING NEIHPUI AN NI
content:
2943/2025-2026

Dated Aizawl, the 16th January, 2026:Nimin, January ni 15, 2026 khan Organic Mizoram (MOM) enkawl Farmers Producer Company zinga Organic Ginger (Sawhthing), Organic Mizo Chilli (Mizo Hmarcha) leh Organic Turmeric (Aieng) chingtu FPC-te koh khawm an ni a. An thlai thar chhuah hralhna kawnga hma lak zui dan tur hrang hrang relin, Irrigation and Water Resources Auditorium-ah, MINECO-ah meeting pawimawh tak neih a ni. He hunah hian Dr. KC Lalmalsawmzauva, Adviser to Chief Minister chu Khuallian niiin, Pi Ramdinliani, Special Secretary, Agriculture & Farmers Welfare Department chuan Meeting a kaihruai a ni. He hunah hian MOVCD-NER Scheme kaltlanga din, Organic FPC zinga Sawhthing, Mizo Hmarcha leh Aieng chingtu Mizoram District hrang hrang ațangin koh khawm an ni.

He hunah hian khuallian Dr. KC Lalmalsawmzauva, Adviser to Chief Minister chuan thu sawiin, loineitute zingah sawrkar puihna dawn chhunga nung, sawrkar aṭanga puihna a tawp ruala tawp ve mai an awm thin chu a that loh thu a tarlang a. Party hrang hrangin kan ramah sawrkarna an siam tawh angin, tuna sawrkar pawh hi hlun tur a ni lo angin a la tla ve leh ngei ang a, chutih hunah chuan an tlak ruala loneitute kalphung dik nei tura sawrkarin a ṭanpui mekte chu tawp ve mai lovin, kawng dik zawka an kal zel chu an duh dan leh an hmathlir lian tak a ni, a ti.

Pi Ramdinliani, Special Secretary, Agriculture & Farmers Welfare Department pawhin thu sawiin, Organic products chu thlai dang aia hlu bik a nih angin a man pawh a to bik tur a ni tih leh a hralh chhuah kawngah pawh FPC-te inlungrual a ṭul thu sawiin, kum kal taa kalphung fuh tawk lote aṭanga inzirfingin, hmasawn a ṭul thu a sawi a. MOVCD-NER scheme a tawp ruala FPC-te an ṭilṭiak mai a, scheme danga an lut leh a nih chuan eng scheme-ah mah hlawhtlinna tak tak an nei chuang lovang, a ti bawk.

FPC Meeting ah hian -

1) FPC hrang hrangten an thlai chin, tharchhuah theih zat turte report pein, sawiho a ni a.2) Man man zawka Organic tharchhuahte hralh dan tur te,3) Organic tharchhuahte Minimum Support Price (MSP) huang chhunga awm ve rawt te,4) Non-Organic/pesticide residue free (invalid certificates) produce rate chungchang te,5) Buyers nen negotiation kal mek sawi zauna te,6) Scheme dang MIDH/INM te nen Convergence chungchang te,7) Transit Certificate chungchang te leh8) Adoption of FPC chungchang te sawi ho a ni.

Kum 2016 khan Mission Organic Value Chain Development for North Eastern Region (MOVCD-NER) scheme kaltlangin Mizoramah Mission Organic Mizoram (MOM) hi Agriculture & Farmers Welfare Department hnuaiah din țan a ni a. Tunah hian District hrang hrangah Mission Organic Mizoram (MOM) hnuaia loneitute tan hmalakna kalpui mek zel niin, tehfung khauh tak nen Organic Certificate pekchhuah ṭhin a ni a. Organic thlai chingtute tan kawng hrang hranga hmalak mek zel a ni.

MOM hnuaiah hian Phase 4-na kalpui mek niin, FPC (Farmers Producer Company) 41 neih mek a ni a. Organic Farmer 27,604 ten ram hectare 26,500 a zau an nei a ni. Mizorama District hrang hrangah District Level Monitoring Committee (DLMC) te din niin, Deputy Commissioner (DC) te chu Chairman an ni a, anni kaihhruaina hnuaiah hian Organic thlai chingtute hmalakna leh hmasawn zel dan tur te enho a, ngaihtuah zui a ni țhin a ni. Thlai thar chhuahte seng leh sawngbawlna kawnga pui tura hmalakna atan Post Harvest Infarstructure FPC te ngaihtuahpui an ni a. Chung atan chuan, Collection Centre (sawmhnih leh paruk) 26 din ni tawhin, Integrated Pack House (sawm leh panga) 15, Small Processing Unit pakhat (1) leh Transport Vehicle sawm leh pakhat (11) pek chhuah a lo ni tawh bawk a ni.

title: "Tourism lama mipui inzirtirna kan kalpui uar dâwn" - Tourism Minister
content:
2942/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 16th of January, 2026:Tourism Minister Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar chuan kumin chhungin tourism chungchanga mipui inzirtirna, inzirna leh inrawn khawmna uar zawka kalpui a nih tur thu vawiin chawhmaa Mizoram Tourism Service Association (MTSA) infuihtharnaah a sawi.

MTSA hian Tourist Lodge, Chaltlang-ah infuihtharna hun hmangin General Conference an nei nghal a, he huna khuallian Tourism Minister chuan Tourism Department kalpui an tum dan sawiin thawktute pawh inbuatsaih lawk turin a chah.

Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar chuan, "Mizoramah khualzin an pung hi a lawmawm takzet a, mipui nawlpui pawh an lawm a, hei hian kan economy pawh a ṭha zawngin a nghawng ngei ang. Hetihlai hian tourist-te hian thil ṭha chauh ni lo, thil ṭha lo pawh an luhpui châng a awm a, heng thilte lo dawngsawng thiam tur leh, tourist nena chenho kan thiam hi a pawimawh a, inzirna uar zawka kalpui a ngai a ni," a ti.

Tourism Minister chuan kohhran, tlawmngai pawl hrang hrang, zirna in leh pawl hrang hrang nen a tam thei anga inhmuh khawma inkawm a ṭul thu a sawi chhunzawm a, "Tourism hi mitin khawih a nih avangin Department-in mal beih chi a ni lo a, ṭan rualna tur a ni," a ti.

Kum khat chhunga khualzin hip thei tur calendar an siam chu a ṭangkai tur thu leh khualzinin zin chhan an neih zel theihna turin 'event' tam zawk buatsaih an tum tih a sawi a, "Mizoram mawina hi tun hma aṭangin a la pangngai reng. Miin an tlawh a, an lo zin duhna turin tourist hip tur event buatsaih a ṭul" tiin, "He mi kawngah hian ṭhenawm state-te hnungah kan tlan mek a, zawi zawiin hma kan sawn chho zel ang," a ti.

Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar chuan tunhnaia khawtlang nen ṭang ruala tourism (community based tourism) kalpuiah hlawhtlinna an hmu chu lawmawm a tih thu sawiin, a hlawkna chu a khaw neituten tel zel turin ruahmanna an siam zel dawn tih a sawi a. Winter Festival lian zawk leh huam zau zawk buatsaih an tum tur thu a sawi lang bawk.

Tun hnaiah tourism hmasawnna tur infrastructure project atan sum beisei an neih thu a sawi rualin, "A pawimawh ber chu infrastructure lam ni loin kan ram mawina pho lan thiam leh khualzin dâwn sawn thiam a ni," a ti a, khualzin dawnsawn kawngah Tourism Department hnathawktute ṭan la zel turin Minister chuan a fuih a ni.

MTSA Infuihtharna hun hi Tourism Director Pi R Lalrodingi'n a kaihruai a ni.

title: CHIEF MINISTER MET DoNER SECRETARY
content:
345/2025-2026

Aizawl, 16th January 2026:The Chief Minister of Mizoram, Shri Lalduhoma, today met Pu Chanchal Kumar, IAS, Secretary to the Government of India, Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER), at his office during the latter’s visit to Mizoram.

During the meeting, various developmental initiatives being undertaken in Mizoram with support from the Ministry of DoNER were discussed. The Chief Minister requested early resolution of pending projects of the Mizoram Government under the Ministry of DoNER and emphasized the need to expedite and simplify procedures, as delays in approvals and fund sanctions often affect the timely implementation of projects.

Pu Chanchal Kumar appreciated the recently established Ginger Processing Unit in Mizoram and noted that ginger is a major source of livelihood for a large number of farmers in the State, with production steadily increasing. He further stated that the Ministry of DoNER attaches great importance to the processing unit.

The Chief Minister was accompanied by Pu Vanlaldina Fanai, Commissioner & Secretary to the Chief Minister.

title: STATE LEVEL MOCK EXERCISE ON EARTHQUAKE DISASTER HELD AT SAITUAL
content:
344/2025-2026

Dated Saitual, the 16th January, 2026:A State Level Mock Exercise on Earthquake was conducted yesterday jointly with other districts. The exercise commenced at 10:00 a.m. with the sounding of sirens. Government Saitual College, Keifang Bazar Market Shed, and the District Hospital were selected as simulated earthquake-affected sites. In the afternoon, at 4:30 p.m., sirens were again sounded and Keifang Mel Veng Market Shed was also designated as an earthquake-affected site.

Incident Commanders and Responsible Officers were appointed for each site, and Observers were also deployed to assess the exercise. Pu V. Laldinsanga, PD, DRDO, was appointed as the Head Observer. From the Command Centre/DEOC, Pu Lallawmawma, CEO, DDMA, Pu Lalthakima Chhangte, SO, and Pi Christina Lalnunfeli, SDC, continuously monitored the activities at the various sites, coordinating with the Incident Commanders and issuing necessary instructions.

The Operations Centre was set up at the FCS&CA Godown Area during the daytime and later shifted to the DTO Office, Keifang, in the evening. Pu J. Rokima, Addl. SP, was appointed as the Incident Commander, who mobilized the required response actions directly from the staging area.

At the simulated disaster sites, casualties and injured persons were attended to by the Quick Response Teams from Sub Headquarters YMA and the Adventure Club. The injured were immediately shifted to the District Hospital, where medical teams provided prompt treatment. Vulnerable groups, including persons with disabilities and the elderly, were also safely rescued by the QRTs.

After the completion of the Mock Exercise, a review meeting of the Incident Commanders and Observers was held at the DC Conference Room.

title: MOCK EXERCISE ON EARTHQUAKE DISASTER RESPONSE CONDUCTED IN AIZAWL DISTRICT
content:
348/2025-2026

Dated Aizawl, 16th January, 2026:A mock exercise on earthquake disaster response was conducted yesterday in various districts of Mizoram. In Aizawl District, the exercise was organized by the Aizawl District Disaster Management Authority (ADDMA) in coordination with the Mizoram State Disaster Management Authority (MSDMA) and the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA). The daytime exercise was carried out at two locations—OLAS School, Tuikhuahtlang, and Lok Bhavan. Aizawl Hospital & Research Centre, Khatla, was designated as the hospital, Lammual Ground as the staging area, and Lok Bhavan as the relief camp.

For the purpose of the drill, an earthquake of magnitude 7.1 originating from the eastern side of Champhai was assumed. Sirens were sounded at 10:00 a.m. The DC Conference Hall was used as the District Emergency Operations Centre (DEOC). Under the leadership of Er. Lalhriatpuia, Deputy Commissioner, Aizawl, and Chairman, ADDMA, ADDMA members monitored the exercise, collected incident reports from the sites, and issued instructions regarding deployment of personnel and resources at the mock exercise locations. During the exercise, building collapses were simulated and a fire outbreak was assumed at Lok Bhavan. Electrical and communication lines, water pipelines were damaged, roads were blocked, and fallen trees and electric poles obstructed roadways.

The mock exercise was conducted again in the evening at Lok Bhavan. Various departments and agencies participated in the exercise, including Aizawl Hospital, Civil Hospital Aizawl, Police, MPRO, PWD, Power & Electricity, PHED, FCS&CA, NDRF, QRT, 1st MAP (SDRF), 3rd MAP (SDRF), CDRT, Fire & Emergency Services, Transport Department, I&PR, Traffic Police, NIC, Aapda Mitra, NCC, and Civil Aviation.

title: MOCK EXERCISE ON RESPONSE TO EARTHQUAKE-INDUCED DISASTERS CONDUCTED IN MAMIT
content:
347/2025-2026

Mamit, 16th January, 2026:Mamit District Disaster Management Authority conducted a mock exercise on response measures to earthquake-related disasters yesterday, along with other districts of the state. As part of the simulated scenario, an earthquake-induced bus accident was assumed at DC Junction, a fire outbreak was simulated at the Circuit House, and damage was assumed at the Government Mamit College Residential Hostel. Various response and rescue operations were carried out to assess preparedness in rescuing the injured and the deceased.

During the mock exercise, information from the disaster sites was promptly conveyed to Mamit District Hospital. Ambulances and emergency personnel reached the sites immediately. On-site response included providing first aid and attending to the injured, while the deceased and seriously injured were transported to the District Hospital. The response teams carried out their duties swiftly and efficiently.

Rescue operations at the disaster sites were carried out by the SDRF, 4th IR Battalion, Mamit College NCC, St. Francis of Assisi School NCC, and the Quick Response Teams. Three Staging Areas were set up, and Relief Camps were also established. Line departments coordinated and provided all necessary support as required.

The Chief Observer for the exercise was Pu V. L. Lura Hauzel, Commander, 4th IR Battalion, while Pu Lalchhuanawma Chhangte, Addl. SP, also served as an Observer. The roles of Incident Commander were carried out by Pu Lalnunfela Chawngthu, SDO (S), and Pi Carolyn L. B. Khiangte, Addl. Deputy Commissioner.

The mock exercise on earthquake disaster response was monitored from the Incident Command Post by Pu K. Laltlawmlova, Chairman, DDMA.

title: MOCK EXERCISE ON EARTHQUAKE CONDUCTED AT THREE LOCATIONS IN HNAHTHIAL DISTRICT
content:
343/2025-2026

Dated Hnahthial, 16th January, 2025:A Mock Exercise on Earthquake Disaster was conducted yesterday in all districts of Mizoram. In Hnahthial District, the exercise was carried out at two locations in the morning—DC Office and Bazar Veng. In the evening, the exercise was continued at the Additional DC Complex. For the purpose of the drill, an earthquake of 7.1 magnitude originating from the eastern side of Champhai was assumed.

The mock exercise began at 10:00 a.m. and was conducted at the DC Office and Bazar Veng, including the residence of Pu J. Lalnunmawia. DC Meeting Hall-I was used as the Control Room, where the Chief Executive Officer-cum-Additional Deputy Commissioner, Pu Zothanmawia Khiangte, convened the Quick Response Teams and Emergency Services. The Site Coordinator, SDC Pu R. Vanlalruata, briefed the teams and immediately deployed rescue personnel to the respective sites to evacuate the simulated victims affected by the earthquake.

During the exercise, the Quick Response Teams, Police, NGOs, and Hospital staff jointly carried out rescue operations for the simulated injured victims. The QRTs and Police rescued the injured, conducted triaging, and transported the simulated injured and deceased to the Hospital by ambulance. At the hospital, doctors and medical staff promptly attended to the simulated casualties.

Live video coverage was arranged in each district. Through the live feed, a comprehensive Detailed Incident Report on the disaster scenario was submitted by the CEO to the Control Room in Aizawl.

At Site-I (DC Office), the simulated casualties included 2 dead, 2 critically injured, and 6 with minor injuries. At Site-II (Bazar Veng), there were 1 simulated death, 1 critically injured, and 2 with minor injuries.

title: Mizoramin sports chawikan kawnga hmalak that vangin award dawng
content:
2939/2025-2026

Aizawl, the 16th of January, 2026:Nizan khan India International Centre, New Delhi-ah “Global Sports Education Convention 2026 and National Awards Ceremony” neih niin, he hunah hian India rama sports leh physical education huang chhunga tithate hnenah ‘National Sports and Physical Education Awards’ sem a ni a, Mizoram chuan sports chawikan leh tihhmasawn kawnga hma la tha, “Best Upcoming State Promoting Sports and Physical Education” lawmman a dawng.

He award hi Mizoram sawrkar aiawhin Pu H. Dolianbuaia, Joint Secretary, Sports & Youth Services Department kutah nizan khan hlan a ni.

Global Sports Education Convention-ah hian mithiam sawm bik leh state hrang hrang aiawhte’n India rama sports leh physical education hmasawnna tur ngaihtuahhoin, an sawiho zingah India in Commonwealth Games 2030 a thlen tur chungchang a tel.

Mizoram sawrkarin hmathlir mumal tak nei chungin sports-ah hma a la a. Olympic Games 2036 thlir chunga Mizoram pum dapchhuaka sports coaching leh talent zawnna tur ‘Empowering Mizoram Sports (EMS)’ chu January 14, 2025 khan Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma’n a hawng a. EMS hnuaiah hian Mizoram khaw hrang hranga naupang kum 8 leh 15 inkar te chu Olympic sports discipline thlanchhuahah ni 15 (darkar 45) chhung training pek chilh an ni dawn a, Mizote thiam zawng, 2036 Olympic Games-a India ram aiawha an tel theihna tur nia ngaih sports discipline-te ngaihpawimawh a ni. Talent nei tha bikte chu residential training pe in uluk lehzuala enkawl chhunzawm an ni ang.

EMS hi Mizoram khaw kilkhawr ber thlengphak tura duan niin Public Private-Partnership (PPP) Mode-a kalpui tur a ni a. Sawrkarin coach leh sports equipment a tum ang a, coach duh khua/veng te'n coach-te veivahna, thlenna leh ei leh in an tum ve thung ang. Hei hi khawtlangin neitu nihna rilru an put a, theihtawp an lo chhuah theih nana ruahman a ni. Coach te hi thingtlang atang pawha online-a awlsam taka dil theih turin ruahman a ni.

EMS kalpui dan hi tihfel a ni mek a, he mi hnuaiah hian December 1 - 5, 2025 chhung khan ‘Trainers Training’ neih a ni a. December 15-18, 2025 chhung khan JICA India nen tangkawpin sports coaching-a mithiam bik Prof. Masamitsu Ito, Nippon Sports Science University, Tokyo chuan Hawla Indoor Stadium-ah coach te training a pe bawk a ni.

Sports-ah a bulthut atanga hmalak tulzia hriain , Mizoram State Sports Council leh Samagra Shiksha Mizoram te chuan May 1, 2025 khan 'Grassroots Sports Development Program (GSDP)' a thawhdunna thuthlung (MoU) an ziak a. Sports Minister Pu Lalnghinglova Hmar chuan a taka kalpui turin August 21, 2025 khan Ramhlun Indoor Stadium-ah a hawng a ni.

GSDP in a tum ber chu sawrkar school-a sports training mumal taka kalpui a ni a. Mizoram hmun hrang hranga centre 46 ah, kum 6 atanga kum 14 inkar zirlai 1000 chuangte chu sports discipline thlan bikah zirtirna pek niin, theihna nei sangte tana kawng inhawng zel tura ruahmanna siam a ni. Mizoram sawrkarin Empowering Mizoram Sports' a kalpui mek nen ṭang kawp thei turin GSDP hi duan a ni bawk.

Sports Minister hmalaknain Mizorama sports tournament lian leh hlun pahnih - Tuipuiral Annual Sports Meet 2025 leh Tuichangral Games 2025-ah %te mumal zawka talent haichhuah kalpui a ni a. Sports discipline an kalpui ṭhinte bakah Tuipuiral Games-ah Boxing leh Archery telh thar niin, Tuichangral Games-ah kum 8 leh 16 inkar tan Boxing, Wrestling leh Weightlifting telh thar a ni bawk. Heng sports discipline telh thara training kalpuina leh tournament buatsaihna senso chu sawrkarin tumin, naupang talent tha zawnna’n hman nghal a ni.

Mizoramin awmze neia hma thlir thui tak neia sports a kalpui chhoh mek hi Golbal Sports Education Convention-ah hian state zinga sports hmasawnna tura hmathlir nei ṭha lawmman hlan a ni ta a ni.
